chapter.title: Edited Volumes and Contributions to Edited Volumes
chapter.para: An edited volume typically does not have an author, but one or more editors, a title, a place and time of publication and an extent in number of pages or volumes.
Again, an edited volume does not have to occur inside something else, but it can: it can be part of a series, and here it follows the pattern of the monograph.

If "articles" are publications that occur inside periodicals, let us then say that edited volumes consist of "edited volume contributions." An edited volume contribution has one or more authors and a title and then it occurs inside an edited volume: here one usually notes the title of the edited volume, its editor(s), its place and time of publication, and finishes off with the location of the contribution inside the edited volume.
We see here the same three-division structure that we noted in relation to the monograph inside a series.

chapter.para: An edited volume may well be part of a series: a constribution occurs within an antholgy that occurs within a series. On the Container tab for a contribution to an edited volume, one is therefore able to record the title of the series that the edited volume belongs to and its location within the series.
